div1.p: Deeks solicits comments on his manuscript, which is intended to educate the public about malaria.

div1.head: Letter from William E. Deeks to Henry Rose Carter, January 6, 1925
div1.p:

N. Y. 24
UNITED FRUIT COMPANY
GENERAL OFFICES, 131 STATE STREET, BOSTON, MASS.
------
MEDICAL DEPARTMENT
CABLE ADDRESS
UNIFRUITCO, NEW YORK
WILLIAM E. DEEKS, M.D.
GENERAL MANAGER
FILE NO.
17 BATTERY PLACE
NEW YORK, N. Y.
January 6, 1925 Dr. H. R. Carter
2121 California St., N.W.E.
Washington, D. C.
Dear Doctor Carter:

I wonder if I could trouble you to run over the enclosed
manuscript and note any suggestions you might wish to make which
will improve or elucidate it. You may freely mark the copy, and
I will be glad to incorporate your suggestions.

I have felt that there was a need for a popular article
describing how malaria occurs and how it can be prevented to place
in the hands of our intelligent employes and school teachers to be
utilized not only for educating themselves, but the public with
which they come in contact. I propose to have the article fully
illustrated with colored plates and half tones, and to issue it in
English and Spanish.

This is the object of the publication and I would appre-
ciate an opinion from you as to whether you think this would serve
the purpose for which it is intended.

Wishing you and Miss Laura the compliments of the season,
and hoping you are quite well,

Very truly yours,
W E Deeks
General Manager
WED/KD
